POLL.Definition: a public vote or study in which people are asked for their opinions about something

SURVEY.Definition: a public study in which people are asked for their opinions about something

TOURIST BOARD.Definition: the official organisation of a country whose job is to attract tourists

LONGEST-REIGNING.Definition: being queen for longer time than any king or queen

BOW TIE.Definition: a neck tie in the shape of a bow

ASSESS.Definition: evaluate or decide on the importance of something

ACCUSATIONS.Definition: claims that he had done something wrong

CAVALRY.Definition: a group of soldiers who fight on horses

JOURNALIST.Definition: a person who writes articles and new stories for a newspaper or magazine

LECTURER.Definition: someone who gives speeches for educational purposes

BRICK LAYING.Definition: the activity of building using bricks

ARISTOCRATIC.Definition: related to the high society class

ANCESTOR.Definition: a relative who lived a long time ago

TRIBUTE.Definition: something given that shows admiration and respect for someone

LANDSCAPED.Definition: improved with trees, flowers and other decorations

ACUTELY.Definition: in a way that shows a deep understanding

GLOW-WORM.Definition: a kind of worm that gives off light in the darkness

GLOW-WORMS.Definition: worms that gives off light in the darkness

RESOURCEFULNESS.Definition: the ability to find clever ways to deal with problems

MANHUNT.Definition: an organised search for a person

STALEMATE.Definition: a situation in which none of the opposing groups can get an advantage

DEADLOCK.Definition: a situation in which no progress can be made

REPUTATION.Definition: opinion of the people about him

PACIFISM.Definition: the belief that war is wrong

DISARMAMENT.Definition: the act of cutting down the size of armed forces

RETROSPECT.Definition: thinking now about something in the past

APPEASEMENT.Definition: trying to keep someone happy by giving in to him

TREATY.Definition: a written agreement between two countries

DISASTROUSLY.Definition: in a way that causes great damage

COALITION.Definition: the joining together of different political groups for a particular purpose

ALLIANCE.Definition: countries that have agreed to work together

CONCESSION.Definition: an agreement, especially after giving something

SCARS.Definition: marks left on the skin after an injury

TYRANNY.Definition: cruel and not fair rule or government

ALLY.Definition: a country that has agreed officially to help another one during a war

ALLIANCES.Definition: countries that have agreed to work together

PERSUADING.Definition: making him accept his point of view

RECURRENCES.Definition: the facts of something happening again

INSTINCT.Definition: the natural ability to understand how things work

KNACK.Definition: a natural skill at doing something

IRON CURTAIN.Definition: the military, political, and ideological barrier separating  the Soviet nations and western Europe from 1945 to 1990.

WITHDRAWAL.Definition: the action of stopping participating in something

REVIVAL.Definition: the act of bringing something back

CONTEMPORARIES.Definition: people who were living at the same time as him

HIERARCHY.Definition: a system in which people are organised according to their status or rank

INHUMANE.Definition: cruel and lacking compassion and humanity

FLOODING.Definition: the covering of land with a large amount of water

SWIFTLY.Definition: in a quick way, without delay

ON STRIKE.Definition: refusing to work as an act of complaint or protest

OPPONENT.Definition: someone who competes with someone about something

SUCCESSOR.Definition: someone who follows and takes the place of someone else

RHETORIC.Definition: the art of using the language effectively

MOUTHWASH.Definition: a liquid used to clean the mouth

SOCIAL REFORM.Definition: a movement organised by a group in order to create changes in society

UNDENIABLE.Definition: unable to be denied, certainly true
